info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 8:17AM EDT until April 6 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Mississinewa River near Marion affecting Grant, Wabash and Miami Counties.
Salamonie River at Portland affecting Jay County.
For the Mississinewa River...including Marion...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Salamonie River...including Portland...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Salamonie River at Portland.
* WHEN...Until late this afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Low spots along the walking trails, including the picnic pavilion, at the Hudson Family Park flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM EDT Sunday was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 3.8 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON
